title: Calorimetry for the ePIC Experiment
abstract:
The EIC will deliver collisions of electrons with protons and nuclei at a
wide variety of energies and at luminosities up to 1000 times higher than HERA.
Precise measurement of both the scattered electron and the hadronic final state
is crucial for the physics of the EIC, necessitating unique designs for the
electromagnetic and hadronic calorimeters in the backward, central, and forward
regions. To ensure maximal containment of energy and acceptance for the
required physics processes, the ePIC detector employs calorimetry over almost
the entire polar angle. These proceedings provide an overview of the current
calorimeter designs being employed in ePIC.
